title: RBI Grade B - ESI - FLM3 - Objective

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to the above scheme? 1.This scheme was launched in the year 2022.
 2. Through Composite Medical Health, it provides a comprehensive package in convergence with PM-ABHIM supporting Gender-Reaffirmation surgeries through selected hospitals.
 3. It provides Scholarships for Transgender Students studying in Class XI and till post-graduation.
 4. It has provisions for Skill Development and Livelihood under STRIVE scheme.
options: Only 1 and 3
Only 1, 2 and 3
Only 1
Only 1, 3 and 4
All  of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statement(s) is/are the incorrect with respect to the above scheme? 1.  As in April 2023 Gujarat has highest number of Garima Grehs under the scheme. 2. Schemes provides for the use of the existing shelter homes available with the State/UTs & ULBs for rehabilitation of persons engaged in begging. 3. In case of non-availability of existing shelter homes, there is no provision for shelter homes under the scheme.
options: 1 and 2
2 and 3
1 and 3
1, 2 and 3
None of the above

quiz.text: So far, more than 100 Transgender Persons have been provided employment in Government and private organisations. As in April 2023, Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment has setup 12 Garima Greh in 9 States under above scheme, these are Maharashtra, Gujarat, Delhi, West Bengal, ___, ___, ___, ___ .
options: (A) Rajasthan, Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, Tamil Nadu & Uttar Pradesh
(B) Rajasthan, Bihar, Chhattisgarh, Tamil Nadu & Odisha
(C) Himanchal Pradesh, Bihar, Kerala, Tamil Nadu & Punjab
(D) Rajasthan, Bihar, Chhattisgarh, Tamil Nadu & Punjab
(E) Madhya Pradesh, Bihar, Chhattisgarh, Tamil Nadu & Odisha

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is incorrect with respect to SBM-U 2.0?
options: It is a centrally sponsored scheme.
This scheme is being run by Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
Recently (April 2023) SBM-U 2.0 launched 2nd edition of  flagship newsletter Swachh Yatra to showcase journey of garbage-free cities
All statutory towns are covered under this scheme
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which among the following statement(s) is/are incorrect with respect to the Swachh Bharat Mission - Urban 2.0 (SBM-U 2.0)?
1. Focus is also on ensuring complete access to sanitation facilities to serve additional populations migrating from urban areas to rural areas.
2. It will be utilizing the principles of 3Rs (reduce, reuse, recycle).
3. Complete liquid waste management in cities with less than 10 lakh population.
4. Centre: State distribution of the project fund will be 25%: 75% for Urban Local Bodies with less than 1 lakh population.
options: (A) Only 1
(B) Only 3 and 4
(C) Only 1, 3 and 4
(D) Only 1 and 4
(E) None of the above

quiz.text:
Which among the following statement(s) is/are correct with respect to Swachh Bharat Mission - Urban 2.0 (SBM-U 2.0)?
1. Well-being of all the urban population will be done through Provision of personal protective equipment and safety kits.
2. Construction & demolition waste processing facilities to be set up.
3. Material Recovery Facilities, and waste processing facilities will be set up, with a focus on phasing out single-use plastic.
options: (A) Only 1 and 2
(B) Only 2 and 3
(C) Only 3
(D) 1, 2 and 3
(E) None of the above

quiz.text: With reference to the distribution of the devices under the above said scheme, which of the following statements are correct?   1. As far as possible, 50% of the beneficiaries in each district shall be women. 2. The devices will be distributed in Camp mode. 3. For the senior citizens aged 75 years or more, the devices are provided at their doorsteps.
options: 1 and 2 only
2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
3 only

quiz.text:
Which statement(s) among the following is/are incorrect with respect to above scheme?
1. In case of multiple disabilities/infirmities manifested in the same person, the assistive devices will be given only in one disability/impairment.
2. With effect from 1st April 2020, special items like wheelchairs with commode, silicon foam cushion etc. are also provided under the Scheme.
3. Scheme is being funded from the Senior Citizens’ Welfare Fund.
4. Maximum cost of generic devices will not exceed Rs. 10000 per beneficiary and for special items Rs. 50000 per beneficiary
options: (A) Only 1
(B) Only 1 and 2
(C) Only 1 and 4
(D) Only 4
(E) None of the above

quiz.text: Under the Scheme, there is no provision to allocate the funds to the State/UT Administrations. Funds are directly released to the ______ under the administrative control of this Ministry, as a sole implementing agency of the Scheme. The implementing agency  will also undertake ____  free maintenance of the aids and assisted living devices.
options: (A) Directorate General of Supplies and Disposals (DGS&D), 1 year
(B) Artificial Limbs Manufacturing Corporation (ALIMCO), 1 year
(C) Artificial Limbs Manufacturing Corporation (ALIMCO), 2 years
(D) Directorate General of Supplies and Disposals (DGS&D), 2 years
(E) Artificial Limbs Manufacturing Corporation (ALIMCO), 3 years

quiz.text: Which of the following statement/s is/are incorrect with respect to the above scheme? A. Handholding and support to new FPOs up to 2 years from year of creation in all aspects will be provided. B. It was launched in the year 2019. C. At least 25% of the targeted FPOs would be in aspirational districts with at least one FPO in each block of aspirational districts.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statement/s is/are correct with respect to the above scheme? A. Cluster Based Business Organization (CBBOs) will provide initial training to Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs). B. Financial assistance of ₹25 lakhs per FPO is provided to CBBO. C. Recently (May 2023) additional 1000 FPOs have been allocated to National Cooperative Development Corporation (NCDC) under FPOs’ Scheme.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are the key features of the above discussed scheme?

A. It has been formulated for families having income less than or equal to Rs 1.50 lakh per annum from all sources

B. Families not availing any such benefits from similar Scheme of Centre Government or the State Government are eligible

C. A dedicated portal has been developed for the scheme
options: A and B only
B and C only
A and C only
A, B and C
None of the Above

quiz.text: Which of the following is not a component of the above discussed scheme?
options: Educational empowerment- Free coaching to students from these communities
Health Insurance through under PM Jan Arogya Yojana Rs. 10 lakh per family per year
Livelihoods to support income generation
Housing (through PMAY/IAY)
All of the Above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to the Employees Deposit Linked Insurance Scheme (EDLI)?

A. Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) is the nodal agency for EDLI Scheme.

B. It was launched in the year 1998.

C. It aims to provide income security to the family of a private sector employee after his/her death.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Faster Adoption and Manufacturing of Electric Vehicles in India Phase II (FAME India II) Scheme has been launched with a total outlay equal to Rs. ________.
options: 6000 Crore
8000 Crore
10000 Crore
12000 Crore
15000 Crore

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement/s is/are correct with respect to the Carbon Credit Trading Scheme, 2023?

A. Ministry of New and Renewable Energy is Nodal Ministry of the Scheme.

B. Registry for Indian carbon market is Grid Controller of India.

C. Entities unable to achieve their target will meet the shortfall by purchasing the certificates from the carbon market.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is incorrect with respect to the above scheme?
options: Nodal ministry for this scheme is Ministry of Finance
People in age group of 18 to 40 years having a savings bank or a post office account who give their consent to join/enable auto-debit are eligible
Rate of premium under this scheme is Rs. 436 per annum
Subject to annual renewal, benefits are available till the age of 55 years
Risk cover is applicable only after 30 days of enrolment

quiz.text: Which of the following statement/s is/are correct with respect to the Atal Bhujal Yojana (ATAL JAL)? A. It is being implemented in 7 states. B. It was launched in the year 2019. C. Department of Drinking Water and Sanitation is responsible for implementation of the yojana.
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements are correct with reference to the functions of National SC/ST Hub?
options: To encourage SC/ST owned units to achieve share of at least 40% of total procurement being made by Central/State Governments, CPSEs, and other government agencies.
To sensitize, encourage and enable SC/ST owned units for participation in Public Procurement Process.
Sharing of SC/ST MSEs data with CPSEs to enhance procurement from SC/ST entrepreneurs.
2 and 3 only
All 1, 2 and 3

quiz.text: What is the minimum size of the house under the scheme mentioned in above paragraph?
options: 20 sq.mt
25 sq.mt
30 sq.mt
35 sq.mt
None of the above

quiz.text: Which the following cannot sell bond under above scheme? A. Small Finance Banks B. Regional Rural Banks C. Stock Holding Corporation of India Limited (SHCIL)
options: A and B
Only A
Only C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: According to the Walk Free Foundation report, the country that tops in terms of the prevalence rate of modern slavery is___________, while the country with the lowest prevalence is _____________
options: Syria, Norway
China, Sweden
Pakistan, Denmark
North Korea, Switzerland
Afghanistan, France

quiz.text: In its report, Walk Free reported that 49.6 million people are living in modern slavery, out of which, India is home to __________.
options: 15 million
20 million
11 million
13 million
14 million

quiz.text: According to the recently (In July 2023) released X report by The United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD), Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in developing countries in Asia in 2022 was ______.
options: $672 billion
$662 billion
$652 billion
$562 billion
$462 billion

quiz.text: As per the paragraph, which of the following would fill the ___’X’_____?
options: Uttar Pradesh
Telangana
Chandigarh
Delhi
Jammu & Kashmir

quiz.text: _______ is the nodal agency for the implementation of Tele-MANAS and _______ is the technology partner.
options: NIMHANS; IIT Madras
NIMHANS; IIIT Bengaluru
NHSRS; IIT Madras
NHSRS; IIIT Bengaluru
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023), Online Training Module on the Juvenile Justice (Care and Protection of Children Act) 2015 has been inaugurated and launched.Which of the following statements is/are incorrect with regards to Online Training Module?1.      It has been developed by the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment in collaboration with the LBSNAA, Mussoorie.2.      It has been inaugurated and launched on the Karmayogi Igot platform.3.      It aims at sensitization and capacity building of all functionaries who need to be aware of the provisions for child safety, protection and welfare right up to the village level.
options: 1 and 3
1 only
3 only
1 and 2
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), the Union Cabinet, chaired by the Prime Minister of India, has approved the introduction of the National Research Foundation (NRF) Bill, 2023 in the Parliament.Which of the following statements is/are correct with regards to National Research Foundation (NRF) Bill, 2023?1.      NRF will be established at a total estimated cost of Rs. 60,000 crore during five years (2023-28).2.      Department of Science and Technology (DST) will be the administrative Department of NRF.3.      Union Minister of Science & Technology will be the ex-officio President of the Governing Board of NRF.4.      The bill will also repeal the Science and Engineering Research Board (SERB) and subsume it into NRF.
options: 1 and 4
2 and 4
2 and 3
1, 2, 3 and 4
Only 4

quiz.text: Recently (June 2023), the 1st meeting of the joint committee of the India-UAE Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement has concluded successfully. Both sides have agreed to more than double the trade in non-petroleum products to _______ by 2030.
options: USD 100 billion
USD 50 billion
USD 120 billion
USD 150 billion
USD 200 billion

quiz.text:
Recently (June 2023), India and Australia have decided to expand the negotiations on Comprehensive Economic Cooperation Agreement by including 15 more areas. Which of the following is/are the areas of expansion?

1.      Agri-tech

2.      Critical Minerals

3.      Space

4.      Gender Innovation
options: 1, 3 and 4
1, 2 and 4
1 and 4
All of the above
None of the above
